rComments: Gerald is a really nice teacher and this class is about as close to a guaranteed A as it can get. Tests are multiple choice and easy. All the assignments are easy except #4, but you get to drop one anyways. As long as you do your work and study a little for the tests you will be fine

I like him as a teacher, but I wish the class was more challenging. As of now, it is WAY too easy. You learn a lot in lectures, but the assignments are a joke. Assignments 1, 2, 3, and 5 take a little under a total of 3 hours to do (you can skip an assignment). Quizzes are also a joke since they aren't timed and you can Google answers if needed.

Many students do not attend class but I did because Moulds made it interesting. Moulds shows enthusiasm almost every lecture. He throws jokes here in there and lets us know some tricks. Exams are easy but do require some studying. Assignments are easy  except for one
Do the assignments study terms for the tests and the online quizzes which all the answers are online and get an easy A
Tons of writing. Very time consuming. Moulds himself is awesome though just not the class itself.

This class is the definition of a piece of cake.  All the weekly quiz answers are online, the exams are the exact same questions as the quizzes (most of the time), and most of the assignments are fair (there is one or 2 hard ones though).  The class is easy but REMEMBER you DO need to still study.  Never went to class and still managed to get an A.

The class subject is very basic you can still learn many new things. He is very clear in lectures and the assignments are straight forward. However, it does not mean the class is an easy A, you still have to pay attention and need to study but again its not that hard because the subject is basic.
I found lecture to be enjoyable enough that even though I already knew most of the material, I attended class anyway.

He is constantly asking students if they understand, calling them out if they don't and being very understanding and not na√Øve about their situation. Does whatever he can to help  a student pass and always reminds students of office hours. He also goes out of his way to calculate how students are doing in the class, which helps.
The class is pretty straight forward, if you don't do the assignments you won't pass. Weekly ecommon quizzes that are copied into the midterms and final.

moulds has a great interest in the subject which makes lecture NOT boring. it is not really necessary to attend to class. Class is composed on 10 weekly quizzes (piece of cake. but make sure not to miss any because there are no retakes), 3 noncom. exams, and 5 assignments (which he chooses best 4). Also, gives a lot of extra credit!!!!
Gerald Moulds is very knowledgeable and this class is very fun. He is really charismatic and I had to fight the urge to go up to him and hug him on the last day of lecture. He is adorable.
I love this class, I cant get enough. I even read the book becuase the stuff is so interesting(note that to pass the class you really dont need to read the book). He is an awesome professor.
I'm in love with his class. Lectures were fun and the 3 exams were super easy if you actually studied for them.
EASY
best class I have ever taken at UCSC. Yes it is an easy class but it is really fun and enjoyable. Try actually going to the lectures they are a lot of fun.

It's a pretty easy college class. That doesn't mean you don't have to do anything, you still need to do your projects and quizzes. Study the online cmpe3 flash cards before midterms and you wild do fine.

This is an upper division writing class, so long papers are expected. He wants you to focus on the clarity of your point, not your grammar. He really wants you to pass. Rewrite your papers for a better grade. Ask him any question and he'll be helpful. Class was a little boring, but he is a really nice guy. My writing improved too.

Besides subject being fairly easy if you're somewhat knowledgeable about computers, his lectures are enjoyable! He really knows a lot of about computers and their history. He makes the class a good time!

Enthusiastic about subject and really tries to make the lectures as interesting as possible. Section is not mandatory, but is helpful if you are struggling with an assignment. You don't need to buy the textbook to do well.

Super easy! Don't get the book. You can find all the answers to the quizzes online (although there is one attendance questions). I never went to class and I did well in the class. Easy GE. Moulds is a really nice guy and he LOVES computers.
Easy teacher, interesting lectures. take it for a GE
Gerald Moulds is such a fun professor! Has an awesome sense of humor and really knows how to give an interesting lecture about something I don't find too much interest in. Awesome guy!

I also had him for my Crown Core section, he was interesting, I rarely got bored. His Personal Computers class was incredibly easy... it's completely unnecessary to attend lecture, and nobody ever does, he gives online quizzes every week and the in class midterms/final are just all the questions he uses from those quizzes...

Great class. Took it to satisfy a GE. Super easy, I rarely went to lecture, but I did spend a good deal of time on the assignments and studied for the tests. Moulds is great. Really laid back, understanding, really helpful. Highly recommend for an easy A.

Moulds is such a nice professor take his class for sure, he's very clear about what will be on his quizzes and tests and he is always willing to help anyone that is having trouble with the assignments.

He is a very nice, cool but slightly dorky guy. You can tell he loves computers and writing. You have 10 quizzes that are due once a week along with 5 assignments that are very spread out. 3 midterms and no final. Overall, very easy class(easy A) and he tries to make things as exciting as possible. He talks really fast though!
Very Great Teacher. Helpful and gives a lot of extra credit :D its hard not to get an "A"
Good teacher, clear lectures. A little too much reliance on student presentations.

Great guy. Interesting and skilled lecturer. This class may be easy, but I was one of those who went to every lecture because he is very interesting. Easy A, yes. I would recommend him to anyone, even if they know about computers. This class touches on a lot of topics and it has enlightened me. Best teacher so far at UCSC for me.

Gerald is a great teacher. I think he is funny. He is aproachable i enjoy going to his class. For some students his class was easy for me it was too but i learned alot i didnt know. I recommend you take his comp class if you want to learn about software & hardware. If you already know about comp. why waste your time learning something u already kno

He looks kind of wierd, and sometimes he tries to be funny but he really isn't. Although this class was an easier A then P.E. in high school. Thank You Gerold!! Has 5 easy assignments, and he drops the easiest one (so just skip the hardest one). Tons of extra Credit!! Midterms are 100% common sense. I never studied or went to lectures & I got an A!

Easy, interesting, useful, funny/not mandatory lectures, BUENO. happy face. take this class. Oh and once he asked me if I had a scantron when I came in late for a test and I think he intended to give me one if I said no. Very cool guy despite looking kinda weird.

Very good class on all levels. Teacher is amazing and gives very interested lectures. For someone like me who did not know how to use excel/program/html before the class, I now have a little background. Yes, this class is a total easy A. I got 100% on all three midterms (95% questions on midterms are gimmes). There is around 15% EC in the class too

Class is pretty easy. Almost all of the work is done online. Only midterms are taken in class. There are no finals for his class. Online quizzes are easy as well. It's straight out of the book. If you know little about computers, this would be a good class. Overall, this class is super easy.

Moulds is a very interesting and thought provoking teacher. He enjoys his work and thus his discussion classes are very enjoyable. The work load is manageable and he offers many chances to raise your grade. He is one of my favorite professors, partly because you can relate to him. In his class you only write 5 papers and give a small presentation.

He is very upbeat and enjoys what he is teaching. Class is based on online quizzes with all answers in the book. Assignments are online too and he drops the lowest score. Very straightforward and easy with not a lot of IN-CLASS time required!

He deserves a lot more respect than he gives. He knows what he's talking about and makes what is usually a boring/easy subject pretty interesting and useful. Three non-accumulative midterms, no final. Take this if you need an IN GE.

Easy A and you can learn a lot if you don't know much about computers. You don't need the textbook if you go to lecture. Great guy and he truly wants people to well in the class. and only about 15% of the class actually goes to lecture and everything is submitted online.
Great guy! overall lectures were  pretty interesting...he was a good lecturer.  i felt bad though because a lot of people were disrespectful and a lot blatantly cheated on tests.
very enthusiastic teacher! drops lowest score out of 5 assignments. study the quizzes/practice exams to get A on exams

He is really enthusiastic about the class and that makes me enjoy it. It is pretty easy because most college students know the stuff he talks about however it goes a little deeper and I like that. This is the only class I actually want to go to. If you need another class TAKE THIS CLASS.

Personal computers was an easy A. DONT BUY THE BOOK, you wont need it and its expensive. Most of the answers you can find by googling the questions. Class is somewhat mandatory - some of the answers to his quizzes are references made only in class. He's a kool guy even if lectures can be a bit dry at times. if you need an easy A, this is the class.
Super easy class. Highly recommend, you learn interesting facts. He goes off topic, but the midterms and finals are super easy. You can get a good grade my skimming the book.

Oh man, Gerald is definitely something. It's unfortunate that since the class is so easy, people just take notes off the powerpoints he posts so they never come to class, so they kind of miss out on this guy. He is something sort of a modest genius and quite a memorable person and he could offer so much more than just teaching a class. Recommended.

I enjoyed this class.  Lectures are kinda long winded at times but he tells funny stories.  Gives lots of extra credit options, including on the exams.  If you can't get a seat during the 1st week - don't worry.  Halfway through, only 25% of the class shows up.

Moulds is a really good professor he is very passionate about computers which makes class interesting. The class is good for common knowledge throughout life as well as a gen. ed. I really enjoyed this class, he is a cool guy. Tests are very reasonable, you need to textbook to take the weekly quizzes. A good class, I recommend it to all majors!
He is very good teacher and his class is fun.  He never waste any time and he is very helpful in office hour.  I like him very much.
Love this class.  He busted out the MAME & played old school arcade.  That is awesomeness to the nth degree.  The answer to #19 is always peacock.
easy class!!! just study the MCs online (which are also practice tests) and you'll get an easy A without a doubt. it's stupid if you don't because he'll give you extra credit

this guy is awesome. i didnt have to buy the book and went to lecture for funsies. every time i talked to the guy he was understanding and accommodating (i had to reschedule a midterm) and he knows whats hes talking about.
really easy, but a really nice guy and extremely helpful and interesting
The guy looks like Snape but doesn't act like him. He is extremely helpful and willing to talk to his students. He even gave us rice krispy treats :)

He's very funny and helpful. This class was the easiest I've taken. I hardly ever went to class and I got an A. Do the quizzes (whose answers can be found online) and study the quizzes for the tests. The assignments are easy, simple busy computer work.

He's awesome! Really funny and the lectures are interesting. It's a simple class, but worth taking because he really is a cool guy. He is more than willing to help students with anything he can and explains everything well
He is awesome!! I love going to his class. He tells good stories that relate to the topic.

Clear, fun, and sometimes very interesting lectures and an easy class to boot. Some of the material is too simple and it can be boring, but it is a basic computer class so that is expected. Lectures aren't mandatory and most students don't attend, but I'm glad that I've attended them. Mr. Moulds is excellent overall.

GREATEST TEACHER IN UCSC, Take this class before he leaves this place. I wish all my classes were like his. Class is easy, but if you are struggling he does his best to help you. Ive seen him help kids set up their new lap tops  so besides class in heart he is a good man for spending his time on his students
Easiest class in history. Lectures are completely silly. basically know someone in the class so they can tell you the participation question, OR stay for the first 5 mins. Nice, funny guy tho

Gerald is god. He is extremely helpful and wants you to pass. He loves computers and helps you anyway he can. My comp broke down and he showed me step by step to fix it, saving me some money. His lectures are clear, interesting, and he is really in to it. you don't even need  the book since he covers everything in depth and posts everything online

Moulds is one of the easier teachers I've taken.  Be sure to speak in his class, and spend a bit of time on the essays.  If you happen to screw an essay up, just resubmit it for a better grade.  While some people think he talks an aweful lot, pay attention to him, he knows what he's talking about.
Class with Gerald was dead easy. I had no problems getting an A. He's funny (if you get it) and pretty interesting to talk to. I didn't skip class just because sitting through it wasn't a bother.

I loved this class! There were weekly quizes and three scantron tests (no final). Graded on the best 4 out of 5 homework assignments. Yes the class was easy, but I enjoyed it because I actually learned about computers. Some of it was review, but most of it was new. If you have never taken a computer class before, I highly reccomend this class.

TOTALLY EASY CLASS! Def good for GE. It's completely unnecessary to go to class other than midterm and final days and you can still get an A. It's fun to go to class though because Moulds is super funny and tells you very interesting facts about the Internet. I was put off by the title of the class orginally, but it turned out being great!

FUNNY GUY! In the nerdy way. Makes jokes all the time, the class is super easy, total easy A. go to class because every week you have a quiz with an attendence question work like a third of it. The quizes are online, question 19 is always mouse. The HW is SO easy if you've ever touched a computer before. You really need no knowledge in the field.

Really straight forward professor. Easy A as long as you read the material before class and complete short write-ups due at the end of class every day. Grades easily on essays and most of the time debates during class.
Gerald is very nice, funny and interesting.  I really liked going to his class.  He is down to Earth and understanding.
Good professor for the subject, on the nerdy side but its to be expected with this subject. Take the class for easy GE but dont expect to learn anything you wont already know.

Class is easy, prof is very enthusiastic about what he's talking about, knowledgable, and brings up interesting points, which is hard to do because the material is extremely boring.  Just study before tests.

Cool teacher fro core class at crown. Unlike all other core teachers, he is not a writting instructor he teaches some tech classes as well. Class only had to write four essays and were on the easy side. Open to any topic of dissusion. Didn't make us do a project that most all other cores had to do. TAKE HIM for core!
I went to class a total of three times and still got an A in the class. Just study the reading before tests and it's easy

Very easy class, just consisted of 4 essays and selected readings. Didn't even have to do the readings after the first few weeks. Likes to talk a lot for a "seminar" class; he'll play devil's advocate if you argue something. Easy A if you talk in class and spend a few hours on the essays.

A little light on the "technical" part, but a very good writing class.  The assignments were pretty interesting since you can pick your own topics, and lectures contained some useful writing advice.  Moulds is a good speaker as well.

This class has no point.  It's like junior high, with presentations and poster projects and boring, pointless lectures.  People only seem to take it because it's a requirement for CE/EE.  Also, the professor has no clue about anything technical, which is funny, since this is a COMPUTER ENGINEERING class.

Class was decent. Fair grader, tho lectures were a bit pointless. Gave some good general writing information and very knowledgable, but didn't cover much about asg's in class. Managed to skip class a lot and do the asgs how I thought they should be done and get an A on all of them, plus A in the class. A challenging class nontheless tho.

The class is exactly hard enough for you to become a great writer and not any harder (the way things should be).  He cuts out the crap busywork and unnecessary lecturing.  Most likely the fairest teacher I've ever had.
Interesting lectures.  Somewhat amusing guy.  Overall, a pretty chill guy.
